content: Combat sport events in 2022 ***ONE 163: Akimoto vs. Petchtanong*** was a [Combat sport](/wiki/Combat_sport) event produced by [ONE Championship](/wiki/ONE_Championship) that took place on November 19, 2022, at the [Singapore Indoor Stadium](/wiki/Singapore_Indoor_Stadium) in [Kallang](/wiki/Kallang), Singapore. ## Background A [ONE Bantamweight Kickboxing World Championship](/wiki/List_of_ONE_Championship_champions#Bantamweight_World_Championship) bout between current champion [Hiroki Akimoto](/wiki/Hiroki_Akimoto) and [Petchtanong Petchfergus](/wiki/Petchtanong_Petchfergus) served as the event headliner. The [ONE Heavyweight Kickboxing World Grand Prix Tournament](/wiki/2022_in_ONE_Championship#ONE_Kickboxing_Heavyweight_Grand_Prix_bracket) Final bout between current [ONE Light Heavyweight Kickboxing Champion](/wiki/ONE_Light_Heavyweight_Kickboxing_World_Championship) [Roman Kryklia](/wiki/Roman_Kryklia) and [Iraj Azizpour](/wiki/Iraj_Azizpour) served as the event's co-headliner. The pairing first met at [Kunlun Fight 69](/wiki/2018_in_Kunlun_Fight#Kunlun_Fight_69) on February 4, 2018 for the 2018 Kunlun Fight +100 kg Tournament, where Azizpour won by extra round majority decision. Their second meeting took place at [Kunlun Fight 80](/wiki/2019_in_Kunlun_Fight#Kunlun_Fight_80) on February 24, 2019 for the 2019 Kunlun Fight +100 kg Tournament, where Kryklia won by unanimous decision. The pairing was previously scheduled to headlined at ONE: NextGen for the inaugural [ONE Heavyweight Kickboxing World Championship](/wiki/ONE_Heavyweight_World_Championship) bout, but Kryklia withdraw due to an undisclosed medical issue. A middleweight bout between former [ONE Middleweight](/wiki/List_of_ONE_Championship_champions#Middleweight_World_Championship) and [Light Heavyweight World Champion](/wiki/List_of_ONE_Championship_champions#Light_Heavyweight_World_Championship) [Aung La Nsang](/wiki/Aung_La_Nsang) and former UFC and WSOF Middleweight title contender [Yushin Okami](/wiki/Yushin_Okami) was originally expected to take place at [ONE on Prime Video 4](/wiki/ONE_on_Prime_Video_4), but was postponed to this event for unknown reasons. [Kwon Won Il](/wiki/Kwon_Won_Il) and Mark Abelardo were scheduled to meet in a bantamweight bout at [ONE on Prime Video 4](/wiki/ONE_on_Prime_Video_4), but on November 4, it was announced that the bout will be moved to this event instead. At the weigh-ins, [Itsuki Hirata](/wiki/Itsuki_Hirata), [Yuya Wakamatsu](/wiki/Yuya_Wakamatsu) and [Asahi Shinagawa](/wiki/Asahi_Shinagawa) all failed hydration test and were forced to take catchweights. Wakamatsu weighed in at 139 lbs, 4 pounds over the limit, Shinagawa came in at 126 lbs, 1 pounds over the limit, and Hirata failed weight and hydration. The bout proceeded at catchweight with Wakamatsu being fined 40% of his purse, which went to his opponent Woo Sung Hoon; Shinagawa being fined 20% of his purse, which went to his opponent Rui Botelho. but Hirata was scheduled to face former [Rizin Women's Super Atomweight Champion](/wiki/Rizin_Fighting_Federation#Women's_Super_Atomweight_Championship) [Seo Hee Ham](/wiki/Seo_Hee_Ham) was the bout scrapped due to Hirata failed weight and hydration, and Ham did not agree to compete. ## Results Main card (YouTube / Watch ONE)Weight classMethodRoundTimeNotesBantamweight Kickboxing[Petchtanong Petchfergus](/wiki/Petchtanong_Petchfergus)def.[Hiroki Akimoto](/wiki/Hiroki_Akimoto) (c)Decision (split) (50–46, 47–49, 50–45)53:00[a]Heavyweight Kickboxing[Roman Kryklia](/wiki/Roman_Kryklia)def.[Iraj Azizpour](/wiki/Iraj_Azizpour)TKO (punches)21:28[b]LightweightSaygid Izagakhmaevdef.[Shinya Aoki](/wiki/Shinya_Aoki)TKO (punches)11:26Middleweight[Aung La Nsang](/wiki/Aung_La_Nsang)def.[Yushin Okami](/wiki/Yushin_Okami)TKO (punches)11:42Catchweight (139 lbs)Woo Sung Hoondef.[Yuya Wakamatsu](/wiki/Yuya_Wakamatsu)TKO (elbows and punches)12:46[c]Bantamweight[Kwon Won Il](/wiki/Kwon_Won_Il)def.Mark AbelardoTKO (knee and punches)33:44Lead card (YouTube / Watch ONE)Heavyweight KickboxingAhmed Krnjicdef.Bruno ChavesDecision (unanimous)33:00LightweightAhmed Mujtabadef.Abraão AmorimSubmission (triangle choke)14:32Catchweight (126 lbs) Muay Thai[Asahi Shinagawa](/wiki/Asahi_Shinagawa)def.Rui BotelhoDecision (split)33:00[d]Women's Strawweight Submission Grappling[Bianca Basílio](/wiki/Bianca_Bas%C3%ADlio)def.Milena Kaori SakumotoSubmission (rear-naked choke)10:43FeatherweightKirill Gorobetsdef.[Bruno Pucci](/wiki/Bruno_Pucci)Decision (unanimous)35:00 ## Bonus awards The following fighters received $50,000 bonuses. -
